TestDescription.name: Solaris in.fingerd information disclosure vulnerability
TestDescription.Description:
A vulnerability in the in.fingerd daemon in Sun Solaris versions 8 and earlier could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive account information. A remote attacker can send a specially-crafted finger request to a vulnerable system to cause a list of accounts to be returned to the attacker. This information can be used by the attacker to launch further attacks against the affected host.[break][break]
The following request is sufficient to disclose a list of users:[break] [bold][dark]finger 'a b c d e f g h'@sunhost[/dark][/bold]
TestDescription.Recommendation: It is recommended to disable this service.

Reference.database: Sun Solaris in.fingerd daemon can disclose account information
